ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned several laboratory skills for genetics experiments, as well as how to perform calculations on data from lab in order to draw conclusions. I also improved my ability to reason through experiments.
I was able to gain basic laboratory skills for various genetic processes which will be helpful for future lab practices and investigation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: I found that Dr. Dawson was a lot of fun and he created a relaxed learning environment that I felt was really effective. I also thought that the experiments themselves were interesting and that I truly learned new skills and concepts that would be useful.

Weaknesses: I found that the lab report guidelines didn't always match up with the grading rubrics. I often felt like I did everything asked for in the guidelines and then somehow there was always something else that I lost points for that was on the rubric (which we are not given) but not in the guidelines.

The labs are interesting, and I liked that we used multiple model organisms and got to see the different procedures for working with them. Professor Dawson was helpful as well. I would have liked if the quizzes were more regular in timing - maybe right at the end of each model organism unit.

Had a hard time reaching out and getting help from both the instructor and TA. Little resources for help. Also, our last three quizzes (which are worth a hefty portion of our grade) were rushed and given to us at the end of the semester back to back.

Strengths: Great broad overview of various laboratory practices that will be useful for future lab research. Also the professor is kind enough to prepare a lot of the tasks before hand which was helpful so that we were focused on the material not the time-consuming tasks. Lab report guidelines were extremely helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're going to take this course, you should have at least a general interest in genetics. If you don't, you're not going to enjoy this lab.

I would recommend this course to any student who wants a biology lab. I found the content engaging and the labs interesting, and the workload was definitely manageable. The labs felt relevant and well-planned, and I enjoyed working with the various model organisms.

I would recommend this course to another student in MCDB because the course is manageable and the professor is always willing to help. I have been exposed to various labs before which I found helpful, but even for the students who hadn't taken a lab, there is a time spent making sure that everyone is on the same page.
more work than you think it will be
